div.p: BIG in the MORE SMALL HORIZONTAL DIRECTION:dimension.
1. The standard general word is guǎng 廣 (ant. xiá 狹 "narrow") referring to anything of get spatial extension, also in various metaphorical senses.
2. Bó 博 (ant. yuē 約 "confined") is primarily metaphorical in application, and its concrete senses applied to physical objects are derived senses of the word only.
3. Kuàng 曠 adds to the feature of broadness and wide space that of emptiness.
4. Kuò 闊 (ant. xiá 狹 "narrow") adds to the concept of broadness of spatial extent that of remote distance, and the word was late to enter the pre-Buddhist language.

5. Kuān 寬 (ant. zhǎi 窄 "narrow") is recorded as meaning "broad" in SHUOWEN and is so used in HOUHANSHU, but the word was predominantly used in metaphorical senses like "broad-minded, forgiving, not strict", and related to huì 惠 "generous".
賅博 (lit) refers figuratively to broadness of learning.
奧博 (lit) refers figuratively to profound and broad erudition.
rough draft to BEGIN TO identify synonym group members for analysis, based on CL etc. 18.11.2003. CH ／

bibl.title: A Dictionary of Selected Synonyms in the Principal Indo-European Languages
“荀子”單音節形容詞同義關係研究
Handbuch der lateinischen und griechischen Synonymik
東漢﹣隨常用詞演變研究

entry.def: Bó 博 (ant. yuē 約 "confined") is primarily metaphorical in application, and its concrete senses applied to physical objects are derived senses of the word only.

sense.def: on a large scale, broadly; from a wide variety of sources; in a wide variety of ways
be large (of a state); be large (of an area of any kind)
be broad, be not narrow (of learning or knowledge), comprehensive, wide-ranging
cause to be broad> broaden, widen (also transferred senses)
have broad learning with respect to
physically broad, wide (of territories or belts etc)

bibl.title: 簡明古漢語同義詞詞典

sense.def: range widely, range universally; be catholic

entry.def: Kuān 寬 (ant. zhǎi 窄 "narrow") is recorded as meaning "broad" in SHUOWEN and is so used in HOUHANSHU, but the word was predominantly used in metaphorical senses like "broad-minded, forgiving, not strict", and related to huì 惠 "generous".

sense.def: be bent on expansion, be expansive in action
cause (oneself) to be broad-minded> take heart
width (of a ribbon); standard width of cloth for sale

entry.def: The standard general word is guǎng 廣 (ant. xiá 狹 "narrow") referring to anything of get spatial extension, also in various metaphorical senses.

sense.def: CHEMLA 2003: width In JZ 廣 does not always refer to the smaller side of the rectangle, but regularly refers to the dimension in the east-west direction. By the time of the commentator Li Chunfeng, this has changed, and 廣 has come to refer to the smaller dimension irrespective of its directionality.
CHEMLA 2003: comparative width; the comparatively wider partJZ 5.1, Liu Hui's comm: 損廣補狹 "one reduces the comparatively wider part and compensatorily increases the comparatively narrower part"
widely; broadly; on a broad scale; in a wide-ranging manner
be wide and large, spacious (as a dwelling, or a territory)
be broad of vision and ambition
broaden what (one) has, create room for (oneself), be expansive about (oneself)
be broad to the extent of, be as broad as
be widespread; reach far and wide
what is broad in scope and importance
(poetic, the word is often reduplicated:) stretch over a vast space
extend (something); develop (something) into a proper extent

entry.def: Kuàng 曠 adds to the feature of broadness and wide space that of emptiness.

sense.def: figurative, poetic: broadness of perspective; immensity
broad vast (as of a landscape view)
be broad and wide-ranging in culture
be broad (-ly learned) with respect to > have a wide-ranging knowledge of

entry.def: Kuò 闊 (ant. xiá 狹 "narrow") adds to the concept of broadness of spatial extent that of remote distance, and the word was late to enter the pre-Buddhist language.

sense.def: wide, broad; SHI 31: widely separated, very distant
from a broad angle, in a vast perspective;
be wide-ranging in what one does
become like open space, broaden (the perspective of one's mind) (in Zen texts often used for describing an enlightenment experience, metaphorically comparing it to the unobstructedness of open space)
be broad and comprehensive in what one does

form.pron: báo bó báo báo bó báo

sense.def: = pu3pu3 溥溥: evoking the idea of great broadness
broad: of one's belt, the broadness of which makes the garment to be tied in a "shallow" way (XUN, Zhang Jue et alii: contended, for others e.g. 'narrow')
